abstract.p: Maintenance of some summer flowers and vegetables described (S)

block.p: To keep new flowers developing on butterfly bush (Buddleia davidii), cut spent flowers back to the next set of buds. Keep deadheading cosmos, snapdragon and calendula. Thin sprawling asters to keep them from overwhelming their neighbors.
Pick summer vegetables while they're young, and plant chard, spinach and bok choy for fall harvest.

If leaves have a puckered surface but normal color, you may be watering unevenly; if leaves are distorted and discolored, aphids may have been feeding. In both cases, the damage is irreversible; next time, you can prevent it by improving watering practices and by regularly monitoring plants and keeping aphid populations in check.
